comments.creator: ecohen@redhat.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729) SearchToolbar/1.2
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110318 Red Hat/3.6-1.el5_6 Firefox/3.6.15

Images with the "background-repeat" CSS property don't get rendered properly, although they should (https://developer.mozilla.org/en/CSS/background-repeat). 

It seems that images with "repeat-x" don't get rendered at all and images with "repeat-y" get rendered, but aren't repeated as expected.

The problem can be demonstrated by browsing to the following page with RHEL 5.x and Firefox 3.6.y:
https://developer.mozilla.org/samples/cssref/background-repeat/

the "background repeat" css property works well on Firefox 3.6.x on Windows XP and on Fedora 14.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. browse to any page that contains an image with the "background-repeat" css property set to "repeat-x"/"repeat-y" on RHEL 5.x with Firefox 3.6.y (example: https://developer.mozilla.org/samples/cssref/background-repeat/)
2. 
3.
Actual Results:  
Image with the "background-repeat" css property isn't rendered at all (in case of "repeat-x") or rendered but not repeated as expected (in case of "repeat-y")

Expected Results:  
Image should be rendered correctly, repeating itself as needed (see https://developer.mozilla.org/samples/cssref/background-repeat/ in Windows XP or Fedora 14)

comments.creator: ecohen@redhat.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> 
> Have you tested in firefox safe mode?
> (http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe%20Mode)

Yes, safe-mode doesn't help.

Please note that everything works well in Windows, Fedora 14 and even on RHEL 6. The problem seems to occur only in RHEL 5.x.
